New Records: Stephen Curry made all 8 of his 3-point attempts, setting a new record for the Warriors with 22 made 3-pointers out of 39 attempts (56% shooting).
Key Match Events: Curry made consecutive 3-pointers in the fourth quarter to extend the Warriors' lead by 30 points, leading to a win with both benches emptied minutes later.
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors, struggling with a 13-17 record, secured a crucial win against the 76ers, who had their 'Big Three' on the court but dropped back-to-back games after a four-game winning streak.
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State's coach highlighted the win as a crucial step toward their championship aspirations, reflecting on the team's improved performance and resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 76ers allowed a season-high points, and both teams had key players playing despite injuries, adding context to their performances.
